Have you ever witnessed that classic comedy where a dad is a one-man circus of parenting fails? Picture this: he's rocking the diaper on backward, treating the baby like a headliner at a rock concert, and scratching his head, wondering why his wife's giving him that "Did I marry the right guy?" look. 🤷  But hey, let's cut him some slack. Postpartum? It's a rollercoaster for everyone. No, seriously! 🎢  Did you know?  ⚠️1 in 10 men experience postpartum depression and anxiety issues?  ⚠️ If you have postpartum anxiety or depression that your spouse is 50% more likely to experience it themselves?  ⚠️ In a recent poll, 80% of spouses said that they were not prepared for postpartum, how to help, how to support their significant other, and how to communicate to their wives?  After surviving postpartum 3x in just 4 years, my husband and I became true postpartum pros.   We've got strategies to rock this whole postpartum thing together, and we're ready to spill the beans.  Parenthood? Not a one-person gig. You gotta be a team, on the same page, for the win. 🙌  Education is your power move, and most dads have no clue what to expect when it comes to postpartum.  I'm here to share this game-changing information with you and your husband, mama!  Please enjoy my Postpartum Dads Survival Guide – my treat to you.  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Postpartum Playbook: Your partner's very own ESPN Highlight Reel from Day 1 to 12 Months postpartum, so he can be the MVP of understanding & support.  ✨Daily Game Plan: Get daily actionable steps (that prioritize mom & dad!) so you can both treasure fleeting moments with your new teammate.  ✨Mental Health Play-by-Play: A breakdown of everything he needs to know about postpartum mental health, so neither of you have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨Uncover our best-kept secrets for surviving those sleepless nights, so you can thrive during the daytime hustle.  Let’s do this mama!! 💪  👉 https://go.ppcareusa.com/ppdadguide

headline: Postpartum Care USA

primary_text:
Are you 6, 12, or even 18+ months postpartum and still experiencing mama rage, chronic fatigue, low libido, or hair loss? It’s time to get the help you NEED!

Mama, I know investing in yourself feels hard when you’re already struggling through so many side effects of postnatal depletion. 

But your kiddos need you to start advocating to get the help you need (and they deserve)…

We’ve been conditioned to believe that postpartum recovery is only 6 weeks long, when in reality – it can go on for YEARS if left untreated. 😣

How you feel today (and have felt for the last few months) doesn’t feel like the woman, mama, or wife you want to be, so how much is it costing you to just accept this as “normal”?

I can tell you…

It’s stripping you of your chance to show your tiny humans the power of self-love and resilience.

It’s forcing you to miss out on precious moments where you’re fully engaged with your family because the physical, mental, and emotional effects of postpartum bog you down. 

But here's the thing…

Healthy moms raise healthy kiddos, and healthy wives live in healthy homes. Period.

That’s why we’re creating generational health for postpartum moms.

Many of the mamas in our community start feeling better in as little as 30 days, and you deserve that, too. 

You deserve to feel strong and energetic. 

You deserve the mental clarity to focus on things you enjoy again (remember when you used to LOVE going to brunch?! 😍) 

You deserve to feel like yourself again, Mama, and my team will advocate for you all the way. 

This is a short-term investment for the long-term health benefits you, your tiny humans, and even your husband deserve. 

Let’s find out what’s really going on in your body so you can get back to your *real* normal. 

Click the button on this ad and book your Virtual Health Assessment today!
headline: 2500 Mamas Thriving Postpartum

But I want to personally assure you that it is. 

“This isn’t a bandaid. Stacia and Sarah have helped me more than my OBGYN ever thought about helping. They help you heal so you can feel empowered and enjoy postpartum.” ⭐

Your PCP/OBGYN means well when they tell you that what you’re experiencing is just part of being a mom.

But deep down, you KNOW something is off, and that Zoloft prescription isn’t doing a thing.

It’s time for you to get the care you need and the relief you deserve. 

Don’t let another PCP/OBGYN write your symptoms off as “normal.”

primary_text: Even though I have a loving, present husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.  My husband wanted to help SO badly, but in the moment I had no idea what he could do for me. primary_text: 👉This is how you go from surviving postpartum to truly thriving and enjoying your postpartum period.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression I have learned what it takes to help a mama THRIVE postpartum.  The key? EDUCATION.   We need to educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prevent baby blues and postpartum depression.   Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth…  But what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed and alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After countless hours of research, podcasts, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping mamas prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression.  Mama, I want to share this information with you!  Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression.   You deserve to have a postpartum experience that allows you and your family to thrive, connect, and enjoy this short time with your precious new baby.   Get instant access for only $9 for a limited time >>  >>> https://go.ppcareusa.com/beyondbirth

Mama, your PCP/OBGYN will tell you chronic fatigue, mom brain, and low libido are “normal” after giving birth, but as postpartum experts, we’re here to tell you it’s NOT. You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔  That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.  But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)...  DM us “EXPERT” to learn what real postpartum care can look like.

Even though I have a loving, present husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.  My husband wanted to help SO badly, but in the moment I had no idea what he could do for me.  Nothing was what I thought it would be…I’ve been a nurse practitioner for a total of 13 years, and I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey.  I was so wrong!  From labor to breastfeeding to postpartum, I felt brand new. And I knew I couldn’t be the only new mom out there in need of help, but without the words to express how I needed my husband to show up.   So after going through postpartum 3x in 4 years my husband and I have created foolproof strategies on how to rock postpartum together. primary_text: Is postpartum life leaving you overwhelmed, exhausted, and struggling to put yourself first? You're not alone…  My name is Stacia and not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years, I am a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care.   This is what I hear from my mama’s all the time…Do any of these sound familiar?   👉Constantly overstimulated by your tiny human(s) and your husband?  👉Difficulty resting/sleeping even if you tired down to your bones?  👉Feeling like you will never have the same relationship with your husband ever again...  👉Yelling from your mama rage and tearful at a moments notice?  👉Unable to decide what is normal in your body in this new stage of life vs what is not supposed to be happening  Many of the women I work with have had their symptoms for months/years, not just for a few weeks postpartum.  Did you know that if left untreated postpartum symptoms can last up to 10 YEARS???  I want to help you mama! ❤️  That’s why I am offering you my 4 Essential Guides (in one!!) That Every Mama Must Have!   Go From Solo Survival to Fully Empowered, Thriving Mama!  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: Check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨Empower Your Postpartum Mental Health Journey: So you no longer have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks: Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.  ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence. primary_text: I am so tired of hearing mamas say that they are “FINE” postpartum.  85% of mamas will suffer from baby blues, postpartum depression, and anxiety and it's about time we finally start to DO something about it.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression I have learned what it takes to help a mama THRIVE postpartum.  The key? EDUCATION.   We need to educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prevent baby blues and postpartum depression.   Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth…  But what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed and alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After countless hours of research, podcasts, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping mamas prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression.  Mama, I want to share this information with you!  Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression.   You deserve to have a postpartum experience that allows you and your family to thrive, connect, and enjoy this short time with your precious new baby.   Get instant access for only $9 for a limited time >>  >>> https://go.ppcareusa.com/beyondbirth

primary_text: 👉This is how you go from surviving postpartum to truly thriving and enjoying your postpartum period. EDUCATION.   We need to educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prevent baby blues and postpartum depression.   Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth…  But what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed and alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After countless hours of research, podcasts, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping mamas prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression. Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression. primary_text:
14-24 months postpartum and still waiting to “bounce back”?

Your OB says your labs are “normal.”

Friends say, “That’s just mom life.”

But you know better.

Because normal doesn’t feel like:

😩 Fatigue that doesn’t lift no matter how much coffee you drink.
😶‍🌫️ Brain fog so heavy you forget words mid-sentence.
💔 Libido that never came back.

Here’s the problem: most OBs only test 5–7 markers.

We test 55+.

And in over 3,300 women we’ve helped, here’s what we’ve seen:

🔎 91% had nutrient deficiencies
🔎 73% had thyroid issues
🔎 58% had inflammation that got ignored

That’s why your labs came back “fine” while you feel anything but.

If you'd like to uncover what’s really going on, DM us HEAL to get started. Tap the button on this ad, then hit send, and our team will follow up shortly to walk you through the program and help you book your first assessment.

primary_text: Nothing was what I thought it would be…I’ve been a nurse practitioner for a total of 13 years, and I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey. Even though I have a loving, present, and supportive husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.   I then realized postpartum care and support in our country was severely lacking, so I decided to change that!  I have researched thousands of hours of postpartum literature, listened to dozens of podcasts, and studied supplement and nutrition protocols in other countries.  I took bits and pieces from postpartum experts to create a postpartum program unlike any other.  I want to share this information with you mama!  Postpartum Care USA is designed to prepare you with education and coaching for your postpartum body, mind, and soul, in order to find beautiful stability and confidence to tackle that 4th trimester. This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: You can check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks:  Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.   ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence.  ✨Our Essential Mental Health Guide: Stay empowered and in tune with your mental wellness, so you know when it's time to embrace support. primary_text: I am so tired of hearing mamas say that they are “FINE” postpartum.  85% of mamas will suffer from baby blues, postpartum depression, and anxiety, and it's about time we finally start to DO something about it.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression, I have learned what it takes to help YOU THRIVE postpartum.  What's the key?  Maternal mental and physical health through EDUCATION from a postpartum expert.    We educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prepare for and significantly reduce the symptoms of baby blues and postpartum depression, and make maternal mental health a priority!  I've uncovered the secrets to thriving during postpartum and I've put them all inside my courses.     Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth… and we love that!  BUT what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support.  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum symptoms.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed, scared, and utterly alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After months and months of research, diving into the data, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping moms prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression. Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum, so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression, anxiety or that feeling of being alone. primary_text: Have you ever witnessed that classic comedy where a dad is a one-man circus of parenting fails? Picture this: he's rocking the diaper on backward, treating the baby like a headliner at a rock concert, and scratching his head, wondering why his wife's giving him that "Did I marry the right guy?" look. 🤷  But hey, let's cut him some slack. Postpartum? It's a rollercoaster for everyone. No, seriously! 🎢  Did you know?  ⚠️1 in 10 men experience postpartum depression and anxiety issues?  ⚠️ If you have postpartum anxiety or depression that your spouse is 50% more likely to experience it themselves?  ⚠️ In a recent poll, 80% of spouses said that they were not prepared for postpartum, how to help, how to support their significant other, and how to communicate to their wives?  After surviving postpartum 3x in just 4 years, my husband and I became true postpartum pros.   We've got strategies to rock this whole postpartum thing together, and we're ready to spill the beans.  Parenthood? Not a one-person gig. You gotta be a team, on the same page, for the win. 🙌  Education is your power move, and most dads have no clue what to expect when it comes to postpartum.  I'm here to share this game-changing information with you and your husband, mama!  Please enjoy my Postpartum Dads Survival Guide – my treat to you.  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Postpartum Playbook: Your partner's very own ESPN Highlight Reel from Day 1 to 12 Months postpartum, so he can be the MVP of understanding & support.  ✨Daily Game Plan: Get daily actionable steps (that prioritize mom & dad!) so you can both treasure fleeting moments with your new teammate.  ✨Mental Health Play-by-Play: A breakdown of everything he needs to know about postpartum mental health, so neither of you have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨Uncover our best-kept secrets for surviving those sleepless nights, so you can thrive during the daytime hustle.  Let’s do this mama!! 💪  👉 https://go.ppcareusa.com/ppdadguide

primary_text: 👉This is how you go from surviving postpartum to truly thriving and enjoying your postpartum period.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression I have learned what it takes to help a mama THRIVE postpartum.  The key? EDUCATION.   We need to educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prevent baby blues and postpartum depression.   Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth…  But what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed and alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After countless hours of research, podcasts, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping mamas prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression. Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression. Even though I have a loving, present husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.  My husband wanted to help SO badly, but in the moment I had no idea what he could do for me.  Nothing was what I thought it would be…I’ve been a nurse practitioner for a total of 13 years, and I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey.  I was so wrong!  From labor to breastfeeding to postpartum, I felt brand new.   And I knew I couldn't be the only new mom out there in need of help, but I did not have the words to express how I needed my husband to show up.   So after going through postpartum 3x in 4 years my husband and I have created full proof strategies on how to rock postpartum together.  This information will change you and your husband's postpartum journey into a beautiful tangle of stability and confidence.  Go ahead, tackle your 4th trimester together with the Postpartum Dad's Survival Guide.  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Postpartum Playbook: Your partner's very own ESPN Highlight Reel from Day 1 to 12 Months postpartum, so he can be the MVP of understanding & support.  ✨Daily Game Plan: Get daily actionable steps (that prioritize mom & dad!) so you can both treasure fleeting moments with your new teammate.  ✨Mental Health Play-by-Play: A breakdown of everything he needs to know about postpartum mental health, so neither of you have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨Uncover our best-kept secrets for surviving those sleepless nights (and let's be real, sex-less nights), so you can thrive during the daytime hustle. primary_text: They told you “mom brain”, hair loss, weight gain, and low libido are just things to accept in postpartum.  You think it’s all happening because you’re not doing enough. Not eating right. Not working out. Not disciplined.  The truth is: these symptoms are likely from nutrient depletion. ‼️  After birth, your body goes through the most nutrient-depleting event it will ever experience.  Out of 3,300 + women we tested, 91% had nutrient deficiencies.  Which means… it’s real, trackable, AND fixable! 💛  Comment "55" below and we’ll help you uncover what’s really going on.
headline: Postpartum Care USA
alternative_copy: Over a year postpartum and still waiting to “bounce back”?  Your OB says your labs are “normal.”  Friends say, “That’s just mom life.”  But you know better.  Because normal doesn’t feel like:  😩 Fatigue that doesn’t lift no matter how much coffee you drink. 😶‍🌫️ Brain fog so heavy you forget words mid-sentence. 💔 Libido that never came back.  Here’s the problem: most OBs only test 5–7 markers.  We test 55+.  And in over 3,300 women we’ve helped, here’s what we’ve seen:  🔎 91% had nutrient deficiencies 🔎 73% had thyroid issues 🔎 58% had inflammation that got ignored  That’s why your labs came back “fine” while you feel anything but.  📋Comment "55" below and we’ll help you uncover what’s really going on.

primary_text: 85% of mamas will suffer from baby blues, postpartum depression, and anxiety and it's about time we finally start to DO something about it.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression I have learned what it takes to help a mama THRIVE postpartum.  The key? EDUCATION.   We need to educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prevent baby blues and postpartum depression.   Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth…  But what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed and alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After countless hours of research, podcasts, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping mamas prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression.  Mama, I want to share this information with you!  Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression.   You deserve to have a postpartum experience that allows you and your family to thrive, connect, and enjoy this short time with your precious new baby.   Get instant access for only $9 for a limited time >>  >>> https://go.ppcareusa.com/beyondbirth

I am thrilled to invite you to an exclusive FREE workshop hosted by Postpartum Care USA and our amazing Nurse Practitioners, Stacia & Sarah!  📅 Date: November 18th, 2024 ⏰ Time: 7:30 PM EST  Join us for an informative and empowering session about how our clinic can serve you!  Discover how to significantly reduce and conquer common postpartum challenges like chronic fatigue, weight gain, anxiety, and mood swings.  Meet our expert Nurse Practitioners, ask questions and get personalized answers from our team on the workshop.  PLUS - We have an Exclusive Giveaway for all attendees!!  Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to learn how our clinic has successfully helped over 1200 postpartum moms with tailored diagnoses and personalized treatment plans. We can’t wait to see you there! 💖  DM "WORKSHOP" to sign up!

You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔  That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.  But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)...  DM us “HEAL” so we can help you thrive in motherhood – not just survive!
alternative_copy: If your postpartum labs came back “normal,” but you’re still experiencing hair loss, weight gain, irritability, or low libido, it could mean your PCP/OBGYN isn’t drawing enough tests.  The truth is…most PCPs/OBGYNs will tell you these are typical effects of giving birth because they simply aren’t equipped to look for what *actually* matters postpartum.  Hi! 👋 I’m Stacia Scott! Not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years but…   I’m a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care. I’ve helped 2500 mamas reclaim their physical, mental, and emotional health after giving birth because I know firsthand that basic lab tests won’t cut it.  That’s why at Postpartum Care USA, we draw 55+ labs that focus on your thyroid health, nutrient deficiencies, hormonal imbalances, metabolic panels, and so much more.   You shouldn’t have to accept things like ❌weight gain, ❌chronic fatigue, ❌low libido, or ❌mom brain as your “new normal”, mama.   I want to help you get the in-depth testing you need to get to the root of these postpartum symptoms for good.  DM me “HEAL” so I can help you thrive in motherhood – not just survive!

primary_text: Even though I have a loving, present husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.  My husband wanted to help SO badly, but in the moment I had no idea what he could do for me.  Nothing was what I thought it would be…I’ve been a nurse practitioner for a total of 13 years, and I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey.  I was so wrong!  From labor to breastfeeding to postpartum, I felt brand new. And I knew I couldn’t be the only new mom out there in need of help, but without the words to express how I needed my husband to show up.   So after going through postpartum 3x in 4 years my husband and I have created foolproof strategies on how to rock postpartum together.  This information will change you and your husband's postpartum journey into a beautiful tangle of stability and confidence.  INTRODUCING>> The Postpartum Dad Survival Course  There has never been ANYTHING like it!   So often new mama’s don’t even have words for their wants and needs in the first days, weeks, & months postpartum!   We’re unlocking ALL the secrets, so you can turn your hubby into the MVP of your postpartum dream team. Here’s a sneak peek at what you can look forward to…  ✨He’ll embark on your postpartum adventure with confidence, patience, and understanding as you bounce between moments of overwhelming love and sheer exhaustion.  ✨He’ll be equipped to step-up in every way as he develops clarity around how to become the Superhero of real-life parenting.  ✨He’ll up-level his ability to communicate while unlocking the secrets to a rock solid foundation for your marriage & family.   ✨As he masters the art of being fully present for you and baby, he’ll also learn how to prioritize self care (because even superheroes need to recharge!)   Not to mention he’ll have access to our mobile app where he’ll be connected to our staff as well as hundreds of other dads (in his shoes!)  Here he’ll have a safe place to ask questions, laugh, vent, and maybe even share a new dad joke.  Go ahead, tackle your 4th trimester TOGETHER with The Postpartum Dad's Survival Course!  Let’s do this mama! 💪

I am so tired of hearing mamas say that they are “FINE” postpartum.  85% of mamas will suffer from baby blues, postpartum depression, and anxiety, and it's about time we finally start to DO something about it.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression, I have learned what it takes to help YOU THRIVE postpartum.  What's the key?  Maternal mental and physical health through EDUCATION from a postpartum expert.    We educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prepare for and significantly reduce the symptoms of baby blues and postpartum depression, and make maternal mental health a priority!  I've uncovered the secrets to thriving during postpartum and I've put them all inside my courses.     Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth… and we love that!  BUT what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support.  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum symptoms.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed, scared, and utterly alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After months and months of research, diving into the data, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping moms prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression.  Mama, I want to share this information with you!  Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum, so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression, anxiety or that feeling of being alone.  We are here for you.   You deserve to have a postpartum experience that allows you and your family to thrive, connect, and enjoy this short time with your precious new baby.  Get instant access for only $9 for a limited time >>  https://go.ppcareusa.com/beyondbirth

Overstimulation, exhaustion overwhelm, mama rage… Any of these sound familiar, mama? It can significantly impact both your physical AND mental health while you're going through all the emotions of being a new mama. 🌸  Remember, every mother's journey is unique, and we're here to support you every step of the way. ad_name: SWS | Manychat | New Mothers | Symptoms no one talks about
primary_text: STOP thinking that these symptoms are "normal" as a new mama!  Fatigue: Feeling constantly tired and lacking energy.  Brain Fog: Difficulty concentrating or remembering things.  Mood Swings: Experiencing sudden and intense changes in mood.  Hair Loss: Noticing increased shedding or thinning of hair.  Low Libido: A significant decrease in sexual desire or drive.  These are NOT "normal" postpartum symptoms. They might be common, but that doesn't mean they should be ignored.  If you feel like you might be struggling with your postpartum journey, schedule a discovery call today.   DM "ACTION" to get started!  Have you experienced any of these symptoms after giving birth?

This is what I hear from my mama’s all the time…Do any of these sound familiar?   👉Constantly overstimulated by your tiny human(s) and your husband? 👉Difficulty resting/sleeping even if you tired down to your bones? 👉Feeling like you will never have the same relationship with your husband ever again... 👉Yelling from your mama rage and tearful at a moments notice? 👉Unable to decide what is normal in your body in this new stage of life vs what is not supposed to be happening  Many of the women I work with have had their symptoms for months/years, not just for a few weeks postpartum.  Did you know that if left untreated postpartum symptoms can last up to 10 YEARS???  After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat all of the above symptoms☝️, I have learned what it takes to help YOU THRIVE postpartum.  What's the key?  Maternal mental and physical health through EDUCATION from a postpartum expert.   I want to help you mama! ❤️  That’s why I am offering you my 4 Essential Guides (in one!!) That Every Mama Must Have!   Go From Solo Survival to Fully Empowered, Thriving Mama!  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: Check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨Empower Your Postpartum Mental Health Journey: So you no longer have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks: Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.  ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence.  Let’s do this mama!! 💪  👉 https://go.ppcareusa.com/ppesstentials-guide

primary_text: Let me be clear on this... we can HELP!  New mamas often aren't told that childbirth depletes their bodies of crucial nutrients. This means many don't realize they need to replenish these nutrients.  Every mama is different, but the top 3 nutrients we commonly see depleted in postpartum blood work are Vitamin D, ferritin, and magnesium. 🌸  If you are depleted of these nutrients, you might have symptoms such as:  **Vitamin D: •Fatigue •Mood changes, including depression •Thyroid issues •Increased risk of infections •Bone & back pain  **Ferritin (Iron Stores): •Extreme fatigue & weakness •Dizziness or lightheadedness •Cold hands & feet •Brittle nails & hair loss •Pale skin •Short of breath  **Magnesium: •Fatigue & weakness •Anxiety & depression •Hormone instability •Mood swings •Insomnia •Muscle soreness (particularly in neck and shoulders)  If you're feeling any of these after giving birth (even up to 10 years after!). DM me "RECOVERY" so we can help you feel better!

primary_text: Mama, you don't need another cute baby outfit or another baby soother. Don't settle for "you're fine!" or "your labs are normal." Advocate for comprehensive blood work to get a full picture of your postpartum health. primary_text: STOP thinking that these symptoms are "normal" as a new mama!  Fatigue: Feeling constantly tired and lacking energy.  Brain Fog: Difficulty concentrating or remembering things.  Mood Swings: Experiencing sudden and intense changes in mood.  Hair Loss: Noticing increased shedding or thinning of hair.  Low Libido: A significant decrease in sexual desire or drive.  These are NOT "normal" postpartum symptoms. They might be common, but that doesn't mean they should be ignored. primary_text: Mama, your PCP/OBGYN will tell you chronic fatigue, mom brain, and low libido are “normal” after giving birth, but as postpartum experts, we’re here to tell you it’s NOT.   Every mama’s journey is unique, but after months (or even years) of feeling this way…  You *know* something just isn’t right. You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔  That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.  But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)...  DM us “HEAL” so we can help you thrive in motherhood – not just survive!

primary_text: 18 months postpartum and still waiting to “bounce back”?  Your OB says your labs are “normal.”  Friends say, “That’s just mom life.”  But you know better.  Because normal doesn’t feel like:  😩 Fatigue that doesn’t lift no matter how much coffee you drink. 😶‍🌫️ Brain fog so heavy you forget words mid-sentence. 💔 Libido that never came back.  Here’s the problem: most OBs only test 5–7 markers.  We test 55+.  And in over 3,300 women we’ve helped, here’s what we’ve seen:  🔎 91% had nutrient deficiencies 🔎 73% had thyroid issues 🔎 58% had inflammation that got ignored  That’s why your labs came back “fine” while you feel anything but.  DM us "RELIEF" (or comment "RELIEF" below) and we’ll help you uncover what’s really going on.

primary_text: Did you know that nutrient depletion can cause all of these postpartum symptoms? 👇  My name is Stacia Scott and not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years, I am a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care.   This is what I hear from my mama’s all the time…Do any of these sound familiar?   👉Constantly overstimulated by your tiny human(s) and your husband? 👉Difficulty resting/sleeping even if you tired down to your bones? 👉Feeling like you will never have the same relationship with your husband ever again... 👉Yelling from your mama rage and tearful at a moments notice? 👉Unable to decide what is normal in your body in this new stage of life vs what is not supposed to be happening  Many of the women I work with have had their symptoms for months/years, not just for a few weeks postpartum.  Did you know that if left untreated postpartum symptoms can last up to 10 YEARS???  After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat all of the above symptoms☝️, I have learned what it takes to help YOU THRIVE postpartum.  What's the key?  Maternal mental and physical health through EDUCATION from a postpartum expert.   I want to help you mama! ❤️  That’s why I am offering you my 4 Essential Guides (in one!!) That Every Mama Must Have!   Go From Solo Survival to Fully Empowered, Thriving Mama!  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: Check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨Empower Your Postpartum Mental Health Journey: So you no longer have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks: Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.  ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence.  Let’s do this mama!! 💪  👉 https://go.ppcareusa.com/ppesstentials-guide

ad_name: 11 Women ad (No hook overlay yet) - Copy
primary_text: ⚠️Standard postpartum care has FAILED new moms. 💗 Postpartum Care USA is here to fix that.  Are you 6, 12, or even 18+ months postpartum and still experiencing mama rage, chronic fatigue, low libido, or hair loss? It’s time to get the help you NEED!  Mama, I know investing in yourself feels hard when you’re already struggling through so many side effects of postnatal depletion.   But your kiddos need you to start advocating to get the help you need (and they deserve)…  We’ve been conditioned to believe that postpartum recovery is only 6 weeks long, when in reality – it can go on for YEARS if left untreated. 😣  How you feel today (and have felt for the last few months) doesn’t feel like the woman, mama, or wife you want to be, so how much is it costing you to just accept this as “normal”?  I can tell you…  It’s stripping you of your chance to show your tiny humans the power of self-love and resilience.  It’s forcing you to miss out on precious moments where you’re fully engaged with your family because the physical, mental, and emotional effects of postpartum bog you down.   But here's the thing…  Healthy moms raise healthy kiddos, and healthy wives live in healthy homes. Period.  That’s why we’re creating generational health for postpartum moms.  Many of the mamas in our community start feeling better in as little as 30 days, and you deserve that, too.   You deserve to feel strong and energetic.   You deserve the mental clarity to focus on things you enjoy again (remember when you used to LOVE going to brunch?! 😍)   You deserve to feel like yourself again, Mama, and my team will advocate for you all the way.   This is a short-term investment for the long-term health benefits you, your tiny humans, and even your husband deserve.   Let’s find out what’s really going on in your body so you can get back to your *real* normal.   Click the button on this ad and book your Virtual Health Assessment today!

headline: Your Postpartum Symptoms Aren’t “Normal”
alternative_copy:
We’ve conducted over 26,000 consultations with postpartum mamas just like you. Here’s what you should know 👇

⌛The longer you wait to get the proper care — the longer it takes for you to feel like *yourself* again. 

🛑Untreated postpartum symptoms can last up to 10 years. Trust me, Mama, you don’t want to feel this way for another 10 years. 

✖️Most PCPs/OBGYNs aren’t equipped to look for postpartum-specific symptoms beyond 6 weeks. That’s why your labs come back “normal” while you feel anything but. 

We do things differently at Postpartum Care USA. We focus on healing the root cause of your symptoms. 

We give you: 

✔️Lab reviews designed to analyze 55+ markers

primary_text: Have you ever witnessed that classic comedy where a dad is a one-man circus of parenting fails? Picture this: he's rocking the diaper on backward, treating the baby like a headliner at a rock concert, and scratching his head, wondering why his wife's giving him that "Did I marry the right guy?" look. 🤷  But hey, let's cut him some slack. Postpartum? It's a rollercoaster for everyone. No, seriously! 🎢  Did you know?  ⚠️1 in 10 men experience postpartum depression and anxiety issues?  ⚠️ If you have postpartum anxiety or depression that your spouse is 50% more likely to experience it themselves?  ⚠️  80% of spouses said that they were not prepared for postpartum, how to help, how to support their significant other, and how to communicate to their wives?  After surviving postpartum 3x in just 4 years, my husband and I became true postpartum pros.   We've got strategies to rock this whole postpartum thing together, and we're ready to spill the beans.  Parenthood? Not a one-person gig. You gotta be a team, on the same page, for the win. 🙌  Education is your power move, and most dads have no clue what to expect when it comes to postpartum.  I'm here to share this game-changing information with you and your husband, mama!  INTRODUCING>> The Postpartum Dad Survival Course  There has never been ANYTHING like it!   So often new mama’s don’t even have words for their wants and needs in the first days, weeks, & months postpartum!   We’re unlocking ALL the secrets, so you can turn your hubby into the MVP of your postpartum dream team.  Here’s a sneak peek at what you can look forward to…  ✨He’ll embark on your postpartum adventure with confidence, patience, and understanding as you bounce between moments of overwhelming love and sheer exhaustion.  ✨He’ll be equipped to step-up in every way as he develops clarity around how to become the Superhero of real-life parenting.  ✨He’ll up-level his ability to communicate while unlocking the secrets to a rock solid foundation for your marriage & family.   ✨As he masters the art of being fully present for you and baby, he’ll also learn how to prioritize self care (because even superheroes need to recharge!)   Not to mention he’ll have access to our mobile app where he’ll be connected to our staff as well as hundreds of other dads (in his shoes!)  Here he’ll have a safe place to ask questions, laugh, vent, and maybe even share a new dad joke.  Go ahead, tackle your 4th trimester TOGETHER with The Postpartum Dad's Survival Course!

primary_text: Mama…postnatal depletion syndrome is so very real and unfortunately, it’s a topic that is severely neglected. 😭💔  Most mamas have no idea what this term even means! Postnatal depletion syndrome is more that just nutrient depletion, it can also mean: hormonal, emotional, physical (etc) depletion.  Most mamas have no idea the importance of proper rest, nourishment, and supplementation postpartum…they aren’t educated on it and I don’t understand WHY!!!! PPCU is here to change that! 🙌🏼🙌🏼  Mama, we want you to understand how your hormones work, the importance of replenishing your nutrients postpartum, what supplements you need and WHY….and most importantly, we want to EDUCATE you and PREPARE you to know when something is off!!!  Mamas deserve better 🫶🏻

Even though I have a loving, present husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.  My husband wanted to help SO badly, but in the moment I had no idea what he could do for me.  Nothing was what I thought it would be…I’ve been a nurse practitioner for a total of 13 years, and I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey.  I was so wrong!  From labor to breastfeeding to postpartum, I felt brand new.   And I knew I couldn't be the only new mom out there in need of help, but I did not have the words to express how I needed my husband to show up.   So after going through postpartum 3x in 4 years my husband and I have created full proof strategies on how to rock postpartum together.  This information will change you and your husband's postpartum journey into a beautiful tangle of stability and confidence.  Go ahead, tackle your 4th trimester together with the Postpartum Dad's Survival Guide. primary_text: Let me be clear on this... we can HELP!  New mamas often aren't told that childbirth depletes their bodies of crucial nutrients. This means many don't realize they need to replenish these nutrients.  Every mama is different, but the top 3 nutrients we commonly see depleted in postpartum blood work are Vitamin D, ferritin, and magnesium. 🌸  If you are depleted of these nutrients, you might have symptoms such as:  **Vitamin D: •Fatigue •Mood changes, including depression •Thyroid issues •Increased risk of infections •Bone & back pain  **Ferritin (Iron Stores): •Extreme fatigue & weakness •Dizziness or lightheadedness •Cold hands & feet •Brittle nails & hair loss •Pale skin •Short of breath  **Magnesium: •Fatigue & weakness •Anxiety & depression •Hormone instability •Mood swings •Insomnia •Muscle soreness (particularly in neck and shoulders)  If you're feeling any of these after giving birth (even up to 10 years after!) CLICK BELOW to book your FREE ASSRSSMENT,  so we can help you feel better!

primary_text: I didn’t believe I would struggle. I was informed, educated, and by all means prepared. And yet, I found myself both isolated and overwhelmed in my 4th trimester.  I have been through postpartum 3 times in the last 4 years.   I am not only a mama, I am also a nurse practitioner trained specifically to treat mama’s during this crucial postpartum period.   My very best friend Chelsea reached out to me 5 days after delivering her sweet baby boy.  She told me that her legs were swollen and her blood pressure was high. I took one look at her and told her she needed to call her OBGYN and that she would need to go to the ER immediately.  Within 12 hours of being in the ER my friend had coded, was intubated, and was sent to the ICU.   Essentially, she went into heart failure and she had less than a 20% chance of survival…   My young, healthy best friend was about to die after giving birth to her first baby boy, what???  By the grace of god, she woke up a few days later.  From that day forward, I vowed to dedicate my life to postpartum care, education, and empower mamas so this never happens to any family again.  I have researched thousands of hours of postpartum literature, listened to dozens of podcasts, and studied supplement and nutrition protocols in other countries.  I took bits and pieces from postpartum experts to create a postpartum program unlike any other.  I want to share this information with you mama!  That’s why I am offering you my 4 Essential Guides (in one!!) That Every Mama Must Have!   Go From Solo Survival to Fully Empowered, Thriving Mama! primary_text: Mama, your PCP/OBGYN will tell you chronic fatigue, mom brain, and low libido are “normal” after giving birth, but as postpartum experts, we’re here to tell you it’s NOT.   Every mama’s journey is unique, but after months (or even years) of feeling this way…  You *know* something just isn’t right. You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔  That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.  But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)... primary_text: Nothing was what I thought it would be…I’ve been a nurse practitioner for a total of 13 years, and I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey.  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum.  Everything was SO hard!   Even though I have a loving, present, and supportive husband, I was overwhelmed and quickly felt alone and uncertain about everything.   I then realized postpartum care and support in our country was severely lacking, so I decided to change that!  I have researched thousands of hours of postpartum literature, listened to dozens of podcasts, and studied supplement and nutrition protocols in other countries.  I took bits and pieces from postpartum experts to create a postpartum program unlike any other.  I want to share this information with you mama!  Postpartum Care USA is designed to prepare you with education and coaching for your postpartum body, mind, and soul, in order to find beautiful stability and confidence to tackle that 4th trimester. The truth is…most PCPs/OBGYNs will tell you these are typical effects of giving birth because they simply aren’t equipped to look for what *actually* matters postpartum.  Hi! 👋 I’m Stacia Scott! Not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years but…   I’m a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care. I’ve helped 2500 mamas reclaim their physical, mental, and emotional health after giving birth because I know firsthand that basic lab tests won’t cut it.  That’s why at Postpartum Care USA, we draw 55+ labs that focus on your thyroid health, nutrient deficiencies, hormonal imbalances, metabolic panels, and so much more.   You shouldn’t have to accept things like ❌weight gain, ❌chronic fatigue, ❌low libido, or ❌mom brain as your “new normal”, mama.   I want to help you get the in-depth testing you need to get to the root of these postpartum symptoms for good.  DM me “55” so we can get you the relief you (and your baby) deserve. ❤️
headline: Postpartum Care USA
alternative_copy: NEWSFLASH: ONE quick visit + basic lab testing with your PCP/OBGYN 6 weeks after childbirth hardly qualifies as postpartum care…but they won’t tell you that.   Instead, they’ll tell you that the unwanted weight gain, irritability with your tiny human (and your husband), chronic fatigue, and low libido are all “typical” parts of your journey.   But they aren’t.  That’s why you need more than a “typical” doctor visit that brushes your experience off as just “baby blues.”  You need comprehensive postpartum care that gives you expert support, full nutrition analysis, and personalized care plans tailored to what’s *actually* going on inside your body. primary_text: 85% of mamas will suffer from baby blues, postpartum depression, and anxiety and it's about time we finally start to DO something about it.   After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat postpartum depression, I have learned what it takes to help YOU THRIVE postpartum.  What's the key?  Maternal mental and physical health through EDUCATION from a postpartum expert.    We educate the entire family on what to expect and how to prepare for and significantly reduce the symptoms of baby blues and postpartum depression, and make maternal mental health a priority!  I've uncovered the secrets to thriving during postpartum and I've put them all inside my courses.     Most mamas have prepared for their baby and for birth… and we love that!  BUT what about preparing for beyond birth?  Even I didn't prepare the first time around. I thought I would be equipped to handle my first born and postpartum journey without support.  I was so wrong!   Nothing was what I thought it would be, from labor to breastfeeding to postpartum symptoms.  Everything was SO hard!   Despite having a loving, supportive husband, I felt overwhelmed, scared, and utterly alone.   That's when I realized postpartum care and support in our country was lacking, so I decided to change that!  After months and months of research, diving into the data, and studying international protocols, I've created a business helping moms prevent and treat postpartum anxiety/depression.  Mama, I want to share this information with you!  Beyond Birth: Baby Blues and Postpartum Depression Online Course prepares you and your family for what to expect in the first days, weeks, and months postpartum, so you do not have to struggle with postpartum depression, anxiety or that feeling of being alone.  We are here for you.   You deserve to have a postpartum experience that allows you and your family to thrive, connect, and enjoy this short time with your precious new baby.  Get instant access for only $9 for a limited time >>  https://go.ppcareusa.com/beyondbirth

Is postpartum life leaving you overwhelmed, exhausted, and struggling to put yourself first? You're not alone…  My name is Stacia and not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years, I am a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care.   This is what I hear from my mama’s all the time…Do any of these sound familiar?   👉Constantly overstimulated by your tiny human(s) and your husband?  👉Difficulty resting/sleeping even if you tired down to your bones?  👉Feeling like you will never have the same relationship with your husband ever again...  👉Yelling from your mama rage and tearful at a moments notice?  👉Unable to decide what is normal in your body in this new stage of life vs what is not supposed to be happening  Many of the women I work with have had their symptoms for months/years, not just for a few weeks postpartum.  Did you know that if left untreated postpartum symptoms can last up to 10 YEARS???  I want to help you mama! ❤️  That’s why I am offering you my 4 Essential Guides (in one!!) That Every Mama Must Have!   Go From Solo Survival to Fully Empowered, Thriving Mama!  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: Check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨Empower Your Postpartum Mental Health Journey: So you no longer have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks: Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.  ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence.  Let’s do this mama!! 💪

primary_text: What if your postpartum symptoms were preventable - and treatable - in as little as 60-90 days?  Here’s the truth: the longer you wait to address postpartum symptoms, the worse they can get. 🚨  And untreated symptoms don’t just “fade with time”…they can linger for up to 10 years.   Mama, you don’t want to feel like this for another decade. 😮  In this video, Stacia Scott, the Founder of Postpartum Care USA, shares the exact process that’s helped over 3,200 moms heal mentally, physically, and emotionally, often in as little as 60–90 days.  👉 I know this is a longer video, but stick with it - it’s packed with insights that can completely change how you feel postpartum. And if you’re ready to take the next step, click the button now to book your Virtual Health Assessment and get a clear, personalized plan for feeling better in weeks, not years.

primary_text: When to request blood work postpartum? This is crucial for your health and recovery, and we have all the answers if you continue reading.  Around 8-10 weeks is ideal, but be aware that standard labs often fall short, and most, if not all providers will not draw the full lab panels that are needed for you to understand root cause issues in your body.  Many providers don't draw the necessary tests because they do not know what to look for, how to interpret the results, or don't want the responsibility of what the results may be.  Don't settle for "you're fine!" or "your labs are normal." Advocate for comprehensive blood work to get a full picture of your postpartum health.   DM me "BEGIN" to get the support and care you deserve!

primary_text: I didn’t believe I would struggle. I was informed, educated, and by all means prepared. And yet, I found myself both isolated and overwhelmed in my 4th trimester.  I have been through postpartum 3 times in the last 4 years.   I am not only a mama, I am also a nurse practitioner trained specifically to treat mama’s during this crucial postpartum period.   My very best friend Chelsea reached out to me 5 days after delivering her sweet baby boy.  She told me that her legs were swollen and her blood pressure was high. I took one look at her and told her she needed to call her OBGYN and that she would need to go to the ER immediately.  Within 12 hours of being in the ER my friend had coded, was intubated, and was sent to the ICU.   Essentially, she went into heart failure and she had less than a 20% chance of survival…   My young, healthy best friend was about to die after giving birth to her first baby boy, what???  By the grace of god, she woke up a few days later.  From that day forward, I vowed to dedicate my life to postpartum care, education, and empower mamas so this never happens to any family again.  I have researched thousands of hours of postpartum literature, listened to dozens of podcasts, and studied supplement and nutrition protocols in other countries.  I took bits and pieces from postpartum experts to create a postpartum program unlike any other.  I want to share this information with you mama!  That’s why I am offering you my Essential Guide to Thriving After Baby!  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: You can check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks:  Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.   ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence.  ✨Our Essential Mental Health Guide: Stay empowered and in tune with your mental wellness, so you know when it's time to embrace support.  Let’s do this mama! 💪

Mama, your PCP/OBGYN will tell you chronic fatigue, mom brain, and low libido are “normal” after giving birth, but as postpartum experts, we’re here to tell you it’s NOT.   Every mama’s journey is unique, but after months (or even years) of feeling this way…  You *know* something just isn’t right. You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔  That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.  But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)...  DM us “HEAL” so we can help you thrive in motherhood – not just survive!

alternative_copy: Have you ever witnessed that classic comedy where a dad is a one-man circus of parenting fails? Picture this: he's rocking the diaper on backward, treating the baby like a headliner at a rock concert, and scratching his head, wondering why his wife's giving him that "Did I marry the right guy?" look. 🤷  But hey, let's cut him some slack. Postpartum? It's a rollercoaster for everyone. No, seriously! 🎢  Did you know?  ⚠️1 in 10 men experience postpartum depression and anxiety issues?  ⚠️ If you have postpartum anxiety or depression that your spouse is 50% more likely to experience it themselves?  ⚠️ In a recent poll, 80% of spouses said that they were not prepared for postpartum, how to help, how to support their significant other, and how to communicate to their wives?  After surviving postpartum 3x in just 4 years, my husband and I became true postpartum pros.   We've got strategies to rock this whole postpartum thing together, and we're ready to spill the beans.  Parenthood? Not a one-person gig. You gotta be a team, on the same page, for the win. 🙌  Education is your power move, and most dads have no clue what to expect when it comes to postpartum.  I'm here to share this game-changing information with you and your husband, mama!  Please enjoy my Postpartum Dads Survival Guide – my treat to you.  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Postpartum Playbook: Your partner's very own ESPN Highlight Reel from Day 1 to 12 Months postpartum, so he can be the MVP of understanding & support.  ✨Daily Game Plan: Get daily actionable steps (that prioritize mom & dad!) so you can both treasure fleeting moments with your new teammate.  ✨Mental Health Play-by-Play: A breakdown of everything he needs to know about postpartum mental health, so neither of you have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨Uncover our best-kept secrets for surviving those sleepless nights, so you can thrive during the daytime hustle.   Let’s do this mama!! 💪   👉 https://go.ppcareusa.com/ppdadguide

primary_text: Feeling lost in the whirlwind of postpartum challenges and struggling to prioritize yourself? You're not alone…   My name is Stacia Scott and not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years, I am a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care.   This is what I hear from my mama’s all the time…Do any of these sound familiar?   👉Constantly overstimulated by your tiny human(s) and your husband? 👉Difficulty resting/sleeping even if you tired down to your bones? 👉Feeling like you will never have the same relationship with your husband ever again... 👉Yelling from your mama rage and tearful at a moments notice? 👉Unable to decide what is normal in your body in this new stage of life vs what is not supposed to be happening  Many of the women I work with have had their symptoms for months/years, not just for a few weeks postpartum.  Did you know that if left untreated postpartum symptoms can last up to 10 YEARS???  After being a nurse/nurse practitioner for 13 years and helping 100’s of mamas prevent and treat all of the above symptoms☝️, I have learned what it takes to help YOU THRIVE postpartum.  What's the key?  Maternal mental and physical health through EDUCATION from a postpartum expert.   I want to help you mama! ❤️  That’s why I am offering you my 4 Essential Guides (in one!!) That Every Mama Must Have!   Go From Solo Survival to Fully Empowered, Thriving Mama!  This FREE GUIDE includes:  ✨Our Ultimate Fourth Trimester Checklist: Check your worries at the door and cherish precious moments with your newborn.  ✨Empower Your Postpartum Mental Health Journey: So you no longer have to say "I'm good," when you're really not.  ✨The Easiest Postpartum Food List and Snacks: Feel nourished, energized, and fully present.  ✨Rediscover Intimacy: Our guide for postpartum couples empowers you to navigate this aspect of your relationship with confidence.  Let’s do this mama!! 💪  👉 https://go.ppcareusa.com/ppesstentials-guide

ad_name: MC53 - stock b-roll video ad - 18mo pp & still exhausted - IG Only - 15 Oct 2025
primary_text:
14-24 months postpartum and still waiting to “bounce back”?

Your OB says your labs are “normal.”

Friends say, “That’s just mom life.”

But you know better.

Because normal doesn’t feel like:

😩 Fatigue that doesn’t lift no matter how much coffee you drink.
😶‍🌫️ Brain fog so heavy you forget words mid-sentence.
💔 Libido that never came back.

Here’s the problem: most OBs only test 5–7 markers.

We test 55+.

And in over 3,300 women we’ve helped, here’s what we’ve seen:

🔎 91% had nutrient deficiencies
🔎 73% had thyroid issues
🔎 58% had inflammation that got ignored

That’s why your labs came back “fine” while you feel anything but.

If you'd like to uncover what’s really going on, just send us a DM to get started. Tap the button on this ad, then type or click "Yes", and our team will follow up shortly to walk you through the program and help you book your first assessment.

headline: Postpartum Care USA

ad_name: MC24 - Symptoms Cycle Carousel_IG Only_TW Heal - 4 Aug 2025 - Copy 2
primary_text:
Mama, your PCP/OBGYN will tell you chronic fatigue, mom brain, and low libido are “normal” after giving birth, but as postpartum experts, we’re here to tell you it’s NOT. 

Every mama’s journey is unique, but after months (or even years) of feeling this way…

You *know* something just isn’t right. You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔

That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.

But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)...

DM us “HEAL” so we can help you thrive in motherhood – not just survive!
headline: Postpartum Care USA

ad_name: MC31 - 'Still exhausted' Carousel - TW 55 - 19 Aug 2025 - Copy
primary_text:
If your postpartum labs came back “normal,” but you’re still experiencing hair loss, weight gain, irritability, or low libido, it could mean your PCP/OBGYN isn’t drawing enough tests.

The truth is…most PCPs/OBGYNs will tell you these are typical effects of giving birth because they simply aren’t equipped to look for what *actually* matters postpartum.

Hi! 👋 I’m Stacia Scott! Not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years but… 

I’m a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care. I’ve helped 2500 mamas reclaim their physical, mental, and emotional health after giving birth because I know firsthand that basic lab tests won’t cut it.

That’s why at Postpartum Care USA, we draw 55+ labs that focus on your thyroid health, nutrient deficiencies, hormonal imbalances, metabolic panels, and so much more. 

You shouldn’t have to accept things like ❌weight gain, ❌chronic fatigue, ❌low libido, or ❌mom brain as your “new normal”, mama. 

I want to help you get the in-depth testing you need to get to the root of these postpartum symptoms for good.

DM me “55” so we can get you the relief you (and your baby) deserve. ❤️

Instead, they’ll tell you that the unwanted weight gain, irritability with your tiny human (and your husband), chronic fatigue, and low libido are all “typical” parts of your journey. 

But they aren’t.

That’s why you need more than a “typical” doctor visit that brushes your experience off as just “baby blues.”

You need comprehensive postpartum care that gives you expert support, full nutrition analysis, and personalized care plans tailored to what’s *actually* going on inside your body. 

Nothing about motherhood is “typical,” and your postpartum care shouldn’t be treated that way.

primary_text:
18 months postpartum and still waiting to “bounce back”?

Your OB says your labs are “normal.”

Friends say, “That’s just mom life.”

But you know better.

Because normal doesn’t feel like:

😩 Fatigue that doesn’t lift no matter how much coffee you drink.
😶‍🌫️ Brain fog so heavy you forget words mid-sentence.
💔 Libido that never came back.

Here’s the problem: most OBs only test 5–7 markers.

We test 55+.

And in over 3,300 women we’ve helped, here’s what we’ve seen:

🔎 91% had nutrient deficiencies
🔎 73% had thyroid issues
🔎 58% had inflammation that got ignored

That’s why your labs came back “fine” while you feel anything but.

DM us "RELIEF" (or comment "RELIEF" below) and we’ll help you uncover what’s really going on.

ad_name: MC31 - 'Still exhausted' Carousel - TW 55 - 19 Aug 2025 - Copy 2
primary_text:
If your postpartum labs came back “normal,” but you’re still experiencing hair loss, weight gain, irritability, or low libido, it could mean your PCP/OBGYN isn’t drawing enough tests.

The truth is…most PCPs/OBGYNs will tell you these are typical effects of giving birth because they simply aren’t equipped to look for what *actually* matters postpartum.

Hi! 👋 I’m Stacia Scott! Not only have I gone through postpartum 3 times in 4 years but… 

I’m a Nurse Practitioner specializing in postpartum care. I’ve helped 2500 mamas reclaim their physical, mental, and emotional health after giving birth because I know firsthand that basic lab tests won’t cut it.

That’s why at Postpartum Care USA, we draw 55+ labs that focus on your thyroid health, nutrient deficiencies, hormonal imbalances, metabolic panels, and so much more. 

You shouldn’t have to accept things like ❌weight gain, ❌chronic fatigue, ❌low libido, or ❌mom brain as your “new normal”, mama. 

I want to help you get the in-depth testing you need to get to the root of these postpartum symptoms for good.

DM me “55” so we can get you the relief you (and your baby) deserve. ❤️

ad_name: AG: Video 11_PND Educational video_Copy1,2,3_IG Only_TW Heal - Copy 2
primary_text:
Mama, your PCP/OBGYN will tell you chronic fatigue, mom brain, and low libido are “normal” after giving birth, but as postpartum experts, we’re here to tell you it’s NOT. 

Every mama’s journey is unique, but after months (or even years) of feeling this way…

You *know* something just isn’t right. You *still* don’t feel like yourself, and these symptoms haven’t just “gone away” like your PCP/OBGYN promised they would. 🤔

That’s because these are all signs of Postnatal Depletion Syndrome (or PND), and not only do they affect your physical health…they can also affect your mental health, too.

But at Postpartum Care USA, we get to the root cause of these symptoms so you can get back to the root of who you are (you know…fun, vibrant, free 🤍)...

DM us “HEAL” so we can help you thrive in motherhood – not just survive!

primary_text:
14-24 months postpartum and still waiting to “bounce back”?

Your OB says your labs are “normal.”

Friends say, “That’s just mom life.”

But you know better.

Because normal doesn’t feel like:

😩 Fatigue that doesn’t lift no matter how much coffee you drink.
😶‍🌫️ Brain fog so heavy you forget words mid-sentence.
💔 Libido that never came back.

Here’s the problem: most OBs only test 5–7 markers.

We test 55+.

And in over 3,500 women we’ve helped, here’s what we’ve seen:

🔎 91% had nutrient deficiencies
🔎 73% had thyroid issues
🔎 58% had inflammation that got ignored

That’s why your labs came back “fine” while you feel anything but.
